args:
While traveling the world, Zodiark adopted the
name Solf in order to hide his true identity.
He then joined up with a group of mercenaries
and fought with them to exterminate fiends.
Nice work, Solf—but I ain't gonna let you\nshow me up! Haaaah!

Within that group, a young man named Lyon was
saving his wages to pay for medicine his ailing
mother desperately needed. Zodiark took great
interest in the lad, and they became fast friends.
Excellent work out there today, boys.\nHere's yer pay—don't go spendin' it\nall in one place, now!
No need to be surprised, young man.\nYou earned all that and more with your\nhard work and dedication.
You fought well, Lyon. Be proud.
Boy, you really know how to pump a\nguy up, Solf!
You know, I never knew my pa, but I bet\nthis is what it would feel like to have him\nbe proud of me.
I'll always remember you, Solf—\neven when I'm finally back in my village.
Yep! With this last payment, I finally have\nenough to cover Ma's medicine.
Now I can finally tell her the truth...
Yeah, see, I sorta lied to Ma when I\nfirst left the village.
I told her I couldn't make my dreams come\ntrue in some dinky little backwater, so I\nwas heading off to the big city.
Why did you feel the need for deception?
Hmm? There seems to be a commotion.\nDid something happen?
Looks like vacation is canceled, fellas;\nwe just got word that another squadron\ngot waylaid by a buncha fiends!

They took most of 'em out, but the ones
that escaped are makin' for a village to
the east of here, and we gotta deal with
it before anyone else gets hurt.
But MY village is east of here!
Ma's in danger! We gotta hurry!
Hold it right there, you damn fiends!\nI won't let you get one step closer\nto my village!
Okay, that was close. These things are\nreally raging out of control!
Wounded fiends are more dangerous than\ntheir healthy brethren. Do not let your\nguard down, even for a moment.
Dammit! We can't cross the river 'cause\na tree fell on the bridge!
Did those fiends do this too?!
We gotta do something or they're gonna\nreach the village!
(If I take dragon form and fly, we may\nbe able to forestall the fiends.)
(Yet if I reveal my true self, I will no\nlonger be able to blend in, which means\nI'll need to leave the area.)
(...Enough. My goals are nothing when\nweighed against the value of human life!)
Worry not, humans. I will lend you my\nstrength. Haaaaaa!
WHAT THE HECK, SOLF?!\nYOU'RE A DRAGON?!
Climb onto my back. I will fly us to the\nvillage so we might intercept the fiends\nbefore they arrive.
I bear you no grudge, fiends, but I will\ngrant no mercy if you attack a human!
Am I seeing things, or is that dragon\nfighting the fiends?
Wait, you're Lyon! I thought you left this\nvillage to go chase your dreams.
So you did all that to raise money\nfor your mother's medicine? Wow.
I'm so sorry, Lyon. I don't exactly know\nhow to tell you this, but...
It happened a few days ago. She fought\nlike hell and gave everything she had,\nbut it just wasn't enough.
But even at the very end, she was always\npraying your dreams would come true.
And she died still believing my lie...
Do you recall why you lied to her, Lyon?
Because Ma was the kindest woman\nalive—the type that always put the needs\nof others ahead of her own.
She never would have let me put myself\nin danger if she knew I was doing it to\nbuy her medicine.
But now she's dead anyway,\nso it all meant NOTHING!
Ma died believing the words of a liar!
I was gonna tell her the truth—I really\nwas! I just needed a little more time!

I wish you the best, Lyon. And if I may,
while you are already an excellent
swordsman, you would do well to further
hone your skills with the mercenaries.
I don't intend to let my lie be a lie any\nmore. From now on, my dream now is to\nstand tall on the battlefield!
Er, but it's gonna be sad not having\nyou around all the time.
You can still come back, you know?\nWe don't care that you're a dragon.
Unfortunately, I still have to learn\nthe true nature of love.
But in order to do so, I must participate\nin human lives as one of them. Now that\nyou know who I am, I cannot remain.
Well, I guess this is goodbye, then.
I can't thank you enough for all you've\ndone for me, Solf. I know I said it before,\nbut I'll never forget you.
It is I who should be thanking you, Lyon,\nfor you have taught me much. Be well.
(The tragedy was almost too much to bear,\nbut I did learn something...)
(Sometimes people deliberately hurt those\nthey love for their own good. This, too, is\nan aspect of love...)
